resources.string:
" "Use BookWorm to keep track of books you have read, and you intend to read. Maintain a log of books that you can quickly view, sort, filter, and rate."

For more information, and to comment or report issues, please visit the BookWorm project site.

Thanks to Google Books and Open Library for making BookWorm possible. "
ISBN format invalid (not ISBN 10 or ISBN 13), cannot retrieve result.
Book not found using ISBN/product code %s (may not be an ISBN?).
"You don't have any books in your list yet. Use the action bar below to add books (by scanning, searching, or form entry)."
"Whoops, that entry didn't work. The product code/ISBN result was %s. Please try again, or use a different entry method. (If you are having trouble scanning a book, check out Menu->Scanning Tips.)"
Book data source not found, internal error, or networking issue.

"*If the scanner works but recognizes a product rather than a book, try looking for a different bar code. Books often have multiple codes. The inside front cover may have another code that is different from the back. Especially for older paperback books, the inside cover code works more reliably.

*Make sure you are not scanning a sticker that has been placed over the bar code by a retailer. Many retailers do this, and the proprietary retailer codes will not scan.

*Some books just do not scan. Product codes that cannot be interpreted as ISBNs will not work. In those cases try a web search for the title. It's still pretty quick, and it will likely work."
Minimum of title and author(s) is required to save book (and book must be saved before managing cover image).
No activity found to handle Gallery selection, cannot use this method.
Error saving book, book information not present, or ID null.
Error retrieving cover image, book information not present, or ID null.
Error generating cover image, book information not present, or ID null.
Are you sure (this will delete all data from database, and images from external storage)?
External storage is not available at this time (may not be present, or may be mounted to a PC?).
Database backup file does not exist, cannot import.
Database backup file exists, but is not readable, cannot import.
This will use the network to try to find and replace all cover images (can take a few minutes depending on number of books in database, and results may vary based on network state).
Resetting cover images, this could take a few minutes...
Warning, your list already contains a book with the same title and ISBN as this one.
By default Splash shown once after install, enable to show at each start.
Enable and then exit/restart app to get detailed logs.
Select specific book data provider (default uses all providers).
Are you sure (this will delete internal backup file)?
Barcode scanner may not be present, would like to check the Market and try to install it?
Place a file named bookworm.csv in the sdcard/bookwormdata directory. Then Parse/Import. See Help for more information.
Unable to parse any data from CSV file for import.
Parsing CSV file (may take some time on large files if using single field format)...
No network connection right now, cannot complete the requested action. Please try again once the network is available.

*The required CSV file location is /sdcard/bookwormdata/bookworm.csv.

*FORMAT 1 Single field: Will be used as a search parameter, can be ISBN, or Title. Try different providers when using single field (main screen, menu->prefs).

FORMAT 2 Specific 13 fields: Title,Subtitle,Authors (pipe|separated),ISBN10,ISBN13,Description,Format,Subject,Publisher,Published Date,User Rating,User Read Status[,User Note] (fields with commas within them must be quoted or escaped).

*The CSV import process will skip the first line of the import file (this is usually the header), and any empty or duplicate entries.

*The easiest way to see an example of the custom format is to use the export as CSV feature. The export feature will place a CSV export file of your current database at the correct location (/sdcard/bookwormdata/bookworm.csv).
Export backup file not found. Please use the export feature before trying to email.
Are you sure (this will replace any existing prior CSV export)?
Are you sure (this will replace any existing prior DB export)?
Are you sure (this will replace all current application data)?
Backup data found, restoring from backup.
